qas.question: What famous school was home to the first English Dominican Order?
Who did the friars build an oratory in honor of?
What was a subject that all Dominican students had to learn?
What was the most important subject for Dominican students?
By what year was the school in Oxford completed?
Where was the first Benedictine site in England?

plausible_answers.text: an oratory to the Blessed Virgin Mary

qas.question: What did the Dominican friars build in 1260?

plausible_answers.text: grammar, old and new logic, natural philosophy and theology

qas.question: What were the subjects that all Benedictine students had to learn?
What was the most important subject that all Benedictine students had to learn?

context: The first Dominican site in <b5_0>England<b5_0/> was at <a0_0>Oxford<a0_0/>, in the parishes of St. Edward and St. Adelaide. The friars built <b6_0>an oratory to <a1_0>the Blessed Virgin Mary<b6_0/><a1_0/> and by <a4_0>1265<a4_0/>, the brethren, in keeping with their devotion to study, began erecting <b7_0>a school<b7_0/>. Actually, the Dominican brothers likely began a school immediately after their arrival, as priories were legally schools. Information about the schools of the English Province is limited, but a few facts are known. Much of the information available is taken from visitation records. The "visitation" was a section of the province through which visitors to each priory could describe the state of its religious life and its studies to the next chapter. There were four such visits in England and Wales—Oxford, London, Cambridge and York. All Dominican students were required to learn <b8_0>grammar, old and new logic, <a2_0>natural philosophy<a2_0/> and theology<b8_0/>. Of all of the curricular areas, however, <a3_0><b9_0>theology<b9_0/><a3_0/> was the most important. This is not surprising when one remembers Dominic's zeal for it.
